newsitem.title: CHINA: CITIC in 4.8 bln yen Beijing subway contract.
newsitem.headline: CITIC in 4.8 bln yen Beijing subway contract.

text.p: China International Trust and Investment Corp (CITIC) has signed a contract with Japanese firms to buy 4.8 billion yen worth of equipment for an expansion of the Beijing subway, a CITIC official said on Tuesday.
"The agreement was signed last Friday," said an official of CITIC International Cooperation Co, the CITIC unit that negotiated the contract.
The agreement, worth about 4.8 billion yen, was signed by CITIC International, the Changchun Passenger Train Co, Japan's Toyo Electric Corp, NABCO Ltd and Nichimen Corp, he said.
Nichimen was negotiator for the Japanese side.

Under the contract, the Japanese firms agreed to supply engines, electric equipment and control systems to the Changchun Passenger Train Co, which has won a contract to make 174 trains for Beijing's underground railway expansion, he said.
The contract would be financed by an export credit obtained by CITIC and the China Technology Import and Export Corp from Japan's Overseas Economic Cooperation Fund last October, he said.
